Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable gem in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: kchappytrails
Reviews.Content: Discovered this gem of a hotel located near desert mountain preserve, Mayo Clinic, shopping and restaurants. Affordable rates. Quiet and relaxed location. Great room amenities such as full kitchen, work space and sitting area, and large swivel tv. Complimentary hot and cold breakfast, eat inside or out by pool. Pool very refreshing and fitness room has all the basics. Overall property very clean and well maintained. Front desk staff friendly and gracious. This would be a very comfortable hotel for 1 night or extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, accessible to shops/restaurants, clean, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pumpsnow1523
Reviews.Content: My first time to stay in this hotel and will recommend to anybody. Location is accessible to Mayo Clinic, shops and restaurants. Easily accesible to the highway. I stayed here for 6 days and everyday, I came back with cleaned room. Room was immaculately clean, with plenty of drawer space, with full kitchen, chaise lounge, with ottoman where I can raise my feet while watching TV. TV can be rotated such that I can watch from the living area or while in bed. Airconditioning temperature can be adjusted. Soft clean white sheets and pillows. Good shower pressure with hot water. Welcome basket consisting of coffee and tea for the first day. Breakfast was available from 6am - with fruits, yogurt, scrambled eggs, potato, sausage, oatmeal, pancake, juice and cereals. What a treat! In the afernoons, there are snacks provided (chips, salsa, cheese and crackers, etc). Shutle is provided complimentary within a 2-mile radius. I rented a car and didn't have to use the shuttle. Service was great, staff was friendly. Recommended good restaurants close by (Kona Grill had delicious sushi and grilled salmon). Only few miles to J W Marriott where I had my conference. Gym is clean and has TV for each treadmill. Bring your headset to plug into the equipment otherwise you will not hear anything. There is a TV where you can use the remote and hear without a headphone, but if you want your exclusive show, use the equipment TV. There is also a mini store for snacks, medicine, and drinks. Fridays have special music or drink events. This is an enjoyable hotel to stay. I will stay again whenever I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here 4 times...”
Reviews.Author: Pick E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here 4 times in the past year, and each visit has been positive. We keep returning because it is a quiet and well maintained hotel. The hotel is a little out of the way in northeast Phoenix, but close to shopping, restaurants, freeway access, and Scottsdale. The only negative was on one morning, the breakfast foods and drinks were completely wiped out 30 minutes before closing, and the hotel should have better anticipated the food since they know the guest count at the hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated, modern, and well equipped. If you can afford it, stay in the very spacious 2 bedroom suite. The pool area is a nice place for lounging. The hotel offers a free shuttle to anywhere within a 2-mile radius. Check out the computer lounge on the 4th floor (quiet and nice view).

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dcanter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so nice! The pool area is great, the breakfast was wonderful, the rooms are large and have everything you need. It had a full kitchen, great sitting area, a desk, free wifi and the TV rotated so you could watch it in bed or in the living room. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a king suite and really enjoyed the stay. The Staff were very friendly, the room clean and a pretty good free breakfast. Also, very close to good food in either North Scottsdale or Desert Ridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Especially for Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff at this property is excellent! I had an excellent exchange with all the staff from the daily shuttle driver to the front desk staff. The only complaint I have with my stay would be with housekeeping and pillows. The beds were comfortable, but the pillow are not . The room was very clean upon arrival, however I had to request my sheets to be changed after 4 days. They were very inconsistent with daily cleaning forgetting to replace tissue toilet paper etc. The fire pits are a very enjoyable feature to the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: MrsReardon
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Residence Inn and I loved everything about it. Just having a full sized refrigerator that I could open and close without fear of being charged for something was a treat, but that I could keep snacks and extra water there was a huge bonus. The room felt homey and I actually looked forward to returning to it at the end of a long day. Property was clean, staff were friendly and helpful, included daily breakfast was great (only thing I'd change is to have coffee available in those carafes all day long vs only in the morning!). Shuttle to take you anywhere in a couple mile radius was awesome - there are tons of shops and restaurants nearby, but definitely not a walkable situation. I'd recommend the Residence Inn and plan to keep an eye out for it in future business travel. Nice job Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: KS69
Reviews.Content: This place was a big surprise. We had an emergency and had to go down to phoenix. We booked a last minute room at the Residence in. The staff was was great very accommodating. the room/suite was very clean and super nice. Great kitchen. The room was large in general and overall a great place. I would not recommend it for a vacation however.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: MikeLVNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn Phoenix Desert View, located next to the Mayo Clinic, over Thanksgiving weekend. My experience was second to none. We arrived very late and check in was fast and courteous, despite the fact that it was after 1:00 am. I'm sure the person working behind the desk was tired, but you would never know that by the way we were treated. My room was excellent. It was a large studio suite with a king bed. The kitchen was updated with stainless appliances and new-looking cabinets. Everything you could need was available in the kitchen. There was a desk, a chair and a pull out couch - plenty of room to relax and get some work done if necessary. Free in-room internet (wired) was convenient and worked well. The television was on a swivel so you could see it from anywhere in the room, including the bed. The large king bed had a firm mattress - not the most comfortable mattress I've ever slept on, but still good. The room was spotless - could not have been cleaner. The bathroom was not too large, but the double sink is located outside of the bathroom which gave some extra room. This hotel offers free breakfast from 6 - 9 am. While I wish it was offered until 10, a little more convenient if you are on vacation and want to sleep in a bit, the breakfast itself was fantastic. There was a wide variety of foods - most of the breakfast staples (eggs, sausage, waffles, pancakes, cereals, bagels, etc.) and they had a special each morning as well (quiche, casserole, etc.) Best hotel breakfast I've eaten. Janet is the woman who runs the kitchen and she does a fabulous job. She's personable and goes out of her way to make sure that guests' needs are met. Even when she was working on Thanksgiving day, she was happy to be there - making sure we all had what we needed, that people knew when the food was going to be cleaned up and even made sure that the Thanksgiving Day parade was on the television. On weekday evenings, there is a social hour with a complementary buffet. We did not take advantage of this, but what was available the one night we were there looked and smelled good. I didn't use the pool or fitness rooms, but they were very nice and well maintained. The fitness room included several machines including treadmills and ellipticals. The outdoor area was comfortable with two firepits that were perfect for the cool night air. There was plenty of seating outside as well. The hotel looks far more upscale than the rates. We paid $115 per night and the place looked like it could be worth twice that. The staff was very responsive and professional. Whenever you passed anyone they were quick to smile and say hello. If I am in the Phoenix area again, I will be staying at this Residence Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Not a vacation atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BroadlandsTraveler61
Reviews.Content: Let me start by say this is a great choice if you have business a Mayo. However, if you are on vacation it not a very good choice. Beds very, very firm and somewhat rumpled when we check in. Really need to iron those linens otherwise it is not a very inviting. This not the first Residence Inn where I have seen this rumpled bed. Better get to breakfast very early otherwise you will have only paper plates. No sanatation wipes in the fitness room, very strange. Not overly friendly staff. Slowest hotel elevator I have ever seen. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Less value for money”
Reviews.Author: BizzeeMom54
Reviews.Content: The good: room was spacious and clean; looked relatively new. If you are there for the Mayo Clinic, I'm sure it offers everything one needs. However, the rate for my stay was obviously jacked up since it was the overflow hotel for a conference I was attending at the nearly JW Marriott. I would have given the Residence Inn an above average rating if the rate had been comparable to the experience. $249 for ANY Residence Inn is not justifiable. Front desk people were not friendly or helpful; breakfast was mediocre. And, even when paying that exorbitant rate, they still charged for wifi. My advice: check the rate before you book. It's worth $179 tops.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMariposa
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved this place. The room was so nicely decorated that we posed for pictures when we arrived. We had a 2 bedroom suite at an unbelievable price. A night's stay in the suite (with kitchen and 2 baths) was the price of a night's stay in a standard room in Sedona. The pool area and outdoor eating/seating areas reminded me of an HGTV redesign. They were lovely and very Southwestern. The free breakfast was very good and the staff was friendly. What more can you ask? There's a little mini-market setup for snacks and things you've forgotten. We didn't spend a lot of time in Phoenix so I can't say whether it's centrally located or not but it was close to the JW Marriott and the concert we were attending. And close to the express, Target, AMC movie theater and restaurants. Pay attention when you drive there. Our GPS told us it was on the opposite side of the street. The hotel is right next to the Mayo Clinic. They share a little road. I was very pleased with my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay with a couple of problems”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it is right across the parking lot from the Mayo Clinic where my wife is admitted. The rooms are great and overall I'd give the hotel a good grade. HOWEVER, I have had a couple of problems. I have repeatedly left instructions at the front desk for specific timing on maid service and even followed up directly with the maid the day before and NEVER received the timing I asked for - each day is like I never talked to anybody. The other problem I have is with the "high speed" internet access. The common access terminal has a great 5Mbs but speeds in the rooms (wired & wireless) are capped at about 45Kbs (5% of what should be available and lower than normal dial-up speeds). Complaints to hotel staff about the internet speed gets a lot of good excuses but no relief. I have no problem recommending this hotel, just don't expect great internet access for work (or leisure) and take your maid service when you get it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: 4manns
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn is very quiet but with easy access to shopping and restaurants. The staff is very friendly. The room was super clean and comfortable for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: talktoandy
Reviews.Content: Stopped into Phoenix for a conference at the end of a two week vacation. After two weeks on the road, I can say the Residence Inn was one of our favorite places that we stayed at. The conference was at the nearby JW Marriott Desert Ridge. The Residence Inn was half the price. The room was decorated nicely with a very comfortable bed, large flat screen, comfortable furniture, good sized bathroom, and a very nice kitchen. The continental breakfast in the morning had a great variety of good tasting items. The pool and workout room were very nice. A bonus is that the Residence Inn ran shuttles to the JW Desert Ridge for the conference although we had a rental car. Provided that you have a car, there is plenty of shopping, dining, and a Whole Foods nearby. They even arranged both an early check-in and late check-out for us. I would not hesitate to stay there again. In fact, I actually looked for the location of other Residence Inns as I would try the chain again just based upon my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel That Seems To Care!!”
Reviews.Author: travelrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in early July and found the rooms to be very nice and exceptionally roomy. They actually had bigger rooms than we had but we found the large kitchen and the two televisions to be quite convenient. The grounds were interesting with prairie dogs, rabbits, and even a desert tortoise. The pool was sparkling although often crowded and somewhat small. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly and the breakfast was very good (and, of course, free). The nearby area had many nice restaurants and extensive shopping options. In conclusion, the Residence Inn Phoenix Desert View at Mayo Clinic seemed to care. What else can a traveler ask for in a hotel staff and management?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable new location, limiting policies”
Reviews.Author: Mik505
Reviews.Content: A new Residence Inn is always a treat - the layout and comfort is just incredible. We enjoy staying at RI for the family friendly accomodations. I was surprised, as was my representative at the Marriott Platinum Premier line, that we were dismissed when attempting to book a 2 bed-room suite with points. The Platinum Premier representative had called the hotel to ask what the point rate would be to make the booking and was told "empthatically" that it is their policy to not accomodate such requests. My personal follow up to the hotel directly was just as surprising, as if I had "told" on them they defensively told me that it costs them money. I was happy to know that the room I wanted went empty all night, despite my offer for of paying the difference in cash or points.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel experience in a location that will meet the needs of some very well and others just ok”
Reviews.Author: DCDoctor
Reviews.Content: Top notch service in a clean, new Residence Inn. Suites are comfortable and spacious....I was wanting for nothing. The location requires a car as you are isolated, except for the adjacent hospital, which this serves well. Like others, I stayed here for a conference at the sprawling JW Marriott, which is very close by. It is a wonderful, affordable alternative tothat facility andi would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with my choice to stay here”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: Had a conference at the nearby JW Marriott Desert Ridge, but they were sold out so I opted for this Residence Inn instead . . . and it was a very pleasant experience. Comments: * The property was very clean and well-kept. * It's a different look and feel compared to what I generally associate with Residence Inns . . . most Residence Inns resemble small low-rise apartment complexes; this place had the architecture of a more traditional hotel . . . though the rooms themselves were consistent with the Residence Inn norms. * The complimentary breakfast was extensive with a lot of variety . . . better than expected. * A small thing that I really like: a small laminated card showing the TV channels. Downside was no Comedy Central so I missed John Stewart and Stephen Colbert. * Complimentary wired internet access - ethernet cable provided; easy to access. * Excellent fitness center . . . though I opted instead to go jogging on the trails that go through the parkland to the south of the adjacent Mayo Clinic (takes about 5 minutes of running to reach the trailhead). * Nice pool and large outdoor patio area, putting green is a nice touch. * Friendly staff. Small concerns: * Other than the Mayo Clinic, the property is in a desolate "no-man's land"; if you do not have a rental car, be aware that there are no shops, grocery stores, or restaurants within walking distance . . . nothing but desert scrub within a 1-mile radius. * I tend to think that placing a full size refrigerator-freezer in rooms at Residence Inns is a waste of energy and environmentally unsound. I suppose there are some long-term guests who fill them up as they would a refrigerator at home, but I would think a compact unit of some type would be sufficient to meet the needs of 99.5% of guests. * Elevators were somewhat awkwardly located . . . not in or adjacent to the lobby . . . you need to take three right turns from the front desk, walking past first floor guest rooms to get to the elevators. Not a big problem, just kind of strange. * It was very expensive . . . but that seems to be the norm for hotels in Phoenix in March. * AC was rather noisy.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: tlinde755
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Residence Inn. There was plenty of room for the two of us and it was very clean. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: nowrest
Reviews.Content: The hotel, which primarily serves the Mayo Clinic, is very clean with suite rooms that are are fully equipped. Most week nights they proviede a complimentary snack buffet and every morning a full buffet breakfast. The best thing is the shuttle bus that will take you anywhere within a two mile radius. The emplyees go out of there way to help you. It is a Marriott so it is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time staying - great experience”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerNJ
Reviews.Content: Since January this is my 3rd visit to this hotel on business. My criteria is pretty simple for business travel. Clean, Quiet, Well maintained It hits the mark on all 3 above 100%. Cool outside sitting area with Gas Firepits! The 'Free' Breakfast is a bit weak and gets very tiring. No real variety. You need a rental car to get around. Nothing beyond the hospital next door is in walking distance. No free newspaper - what happened here? I am used to getting my USA-Today with breakfast! No restaurant (even a basic one) is definitely a drawback (hence needing the car).

Reviews.Title: “Great facility and great value”
Reviews.Author: jsgopus
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the JW Marriott and brought the family along and we decided to stay at the Residence Inn. Very convenient for the conference as it is about 1-1/2 miles from the JW and the Residence Inn offers a shuttle service within two miles of the hotel. For the same price of a single room with two queens at the JW, we got a two bedroom suite (each with its own door, TV and a full bathroom) with a living room (with a TV and a sofa with pull out bed) and a full kitchen (fridge, stove, oven, microwave and dishwasher, and dish/glassware, hotel will also do shopping for you and a Whole Foods and Trader Joe's nearby). We went with our 3-year old and 5-year old, so my wife and I had our own room and each child had his/her own bed, one in the bedroom, other on the pull out couch. Room also comes with free wi-fi as well as hardwire Internet access. Each morning there is also a complementary breakfast with eggs, pancakes, waffles, cereal, muffins, bagels, coffee and OJ. There is a pool, an outdoor sitting area with firepits and a gas BBQ and a putting green. Hotel also has putters and balls and kids played around on that quite a bit. Free parking in outdoor parking lot. 24 hour "marketplace" in hotel where you can get food, beverages (incl. wine and beer, but no Coca-Cola!) and toiletries. Staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the attendants at the complimentary breakfast. The hotel is very clean and fairly new, very well kept. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for families. My one minor complaint: not very environmentally conscious, all styrofoam plates and bowls at breakfast and disposable serverware. Why not recyclable plates and bowls and serverware? If I can re-use the towels as requested, Marriott can make its own efforts to be better in the recyclable department. Overall, minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 3 weeks as hospital patient... very comfortable place to recover.”
Reviews.Author: explorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 3 separate occasions in the Spring of 2010. Being a surgery patient at the adjacent hospital, I couldn't have gotten closer (5 minute walk) to my care. The hotel staff was very caring, attentive, and helpful. I was mostly here by myself, and every morning the breakfast staff asked how I was doing and asked if I needed anything. They seemed to really care. The rooms were wonderful. I had various suites (including the 2 bedroom one). Beds were great, plush, and clean. The TV's were nice, flat-screens. The kitchens were very well outfitted (no oven), and spacious. The pool was heated and inviting, with comfortable chairs and cabanas. There was free shuttle service to multiple shopping/restaurant destinations. The staff was quick, courteous, and attentive. That part of Phoenix is considered one of the nicest... most upscale areas. Close to great shopping, dining, and grocery stores, though not conducive for walking (no sidewalks). I assume most guests are from the Mayo Clinic Hospital or on business. Not really a tourist destination as far as I can tell. Only cons: No on-site restaurant (although breakfast was included and great).

Reviews.Title: “Apartment Feel”
Reviews.Author: carremel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn- Mayo Clinic while traveling on business in the area. The room was like a little apartment, complete with a kitchen, dishes, full fridge. Made my stay very comfortable, and made it easy to stop at nearby grocery to have items to make some of my own meals so I didn't have to worry about restaurant hours after late meetings. Very close to mall & shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Mayo Hospital Patients”
Reviews.Author: Nandu51
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to stay if you're a patient at the Mayo hospital--it's within easy walking distance. The rooms are large and comfortable. The full kitchens and nearby grocery stores make food during long stays less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Mayo Clinic patients”
Reviews.Author: Brucer22
Reviews.Content: This stay is just a average, except for those who need the closeness of Mayo Clinic. It is ideal due to its location for Mayo Clinic; otherwise, there are better stays within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Facility”
Reviews.Author: star111
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying in a Residence Inn and I couldn't believe how spacious my room was. I had two beds, a dining table with two chairs, a full kitchen, a desk, a chair, and a couch bed. The main lobby was also huge and had countless little seating areas. There were also seating areas outside. There was an outdoor pool, a small putting green, and a great exercise room Each morning, they had a full breakfast and two evenings they had a dinner (hamburgers or baked potato bar), all included in the price of the room. It is within walking distance (less than 10 minutes) to the Mayo Clinic Hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeeterApopka
Reviews.Content: Staff is the very best. The rooms were the best ever-very very relaxing. Bed was the best. Cannot say enough great things....

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mishl102891
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Everything looked brand new, and the rooms were very spacious and comfortable. There was a full-size fridge, kitchen utensils, and dishes in the room which was very convenient. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very nice as well, and a staff member even helped me use the waffle-maker. Didn't get to use the pool, but the area outside looked nice too. Overall, great home-y feeling.. I would stay here if I went to Phoenix again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow -- This is as Good as it Gets - Brand New!”
Reviews.Author: tom_cactusguy
Reviews.Content: We loved the new Residence Inn which opened in Feb. 2009. It mainly serves the Mayo Clinic guests, but for us, it was perfect. There is a small kitchen with stainless steel appliances, nice quiet pool and small workout area. We like that it is brand new and somewhat unfound yet......now the secret is out!

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Phoenix Desert View at Mayo Clinic
HotelInfo.Address: 5665 E Mayo Boulevard, Phoenix, AZ 85054
